title: Task 1: Describe visual characteristics of a work of art.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does NOT accurately describe ONE VISUAL characteristic of Vermeerâ€™s The Milkmaid.
Response accurately uses ONE example of specific VISUAL evidence to describe The Milkmaid.
Response accurately uses TWO examples of specific VISUAL evidence to describe The Milkmaid.

title: Task 2: Explains how artistic decisions shape the form, style, materials, or content.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does NOT accurately use any examples of specific VISUAL evidence to explain how the visual characteristics contribute to a harmonious mood.
Response accurately uses ONE example of specific VISUAL evidence to explain how the visual characteristics contribute to a harmonious mood.
Response accurately uses TWO examples of specific VISUAL evidence to explain how the visual characteristics contribute to a harmonious mood.

title: Task 3: Accurately explains how a specific work of art demonstrates change within an artistic tradition, style, or practice.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: The response does NOT accurately explain how The Milkmaid exemplifies genre painting in seventeenth-century northern Europe.
The response accurately explains how The Milkmaid exemplifies genre painting in seventeenth-century northern Europe.
